If you're using a pulse that strong wouldn't it knock out every piece 
of machinery in the base including the transformers?

The first bugs it hit were quickly eliminated. the ones furthest away 
from the pulse shut themselves down on a time delay. they would 
remain inactive for a day then reactivate. These bugs were programmed 
for survival, they intended to keep it that way. (Even though they 
technically aren't alive.)

In the distance one of the babies watched and waited. it too shut 
down in case the pulse was strong enough to eliminate it too. Its day 
would come, just not today.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, kinger01030@c... wrote:
>  Famine heard the noise..."Damn the bugs are still alive...lets try 
something 
> new." He sent another pulse. It was 3 times as strong as the other 
but was 
> purley electronic. It would take out the comps for an hour but 
thats all. the 
> pulse flew threw the ship and all the computers shut off
